IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: AWARD SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS AND GRANTS TO COMMUNITY CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: AWARD SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS AND GRANTS TO COMMUNITY CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS.
IRS990.Desc: COMMUNITY GRANTS PROGRAM - PROVIDES GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS SERVING INDIVIDUALS IN NEED. IN 2018, 41 ORGANIZATIONS RECEIVED GRANTS FROM THE MADISON ROTARY FOUNDATION, AND EACH ORGANIZATION IS SERVING A NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS IN NEED IN THE COMMUNITY (EACH ORGANIZATION NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS VARIES FROM 10 TO OVER 1,000).

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM - PROVIDES FOUR-YEAR COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE TO HIGH SCHOOL SENIORS IN NEED OF FINANCIAL RESOURCES TO ATTEND COLLEGE. STUDENTS IN THE PROGRAM MUST SUBMIT AN OFFICIAL TRANSCRIPT FROM THEIR COLLEGE IN ORDER TO CONTINUE RECEIVING THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, AND 25-29 STUDENTS RECEIVED SCHOLARSHIPS. WE ALSO PROVIDED ONE TWO-YEAR COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: YOUTH AWARDS PROGRAM - PROVIDES ONE-TIME AWARD AMOUNTS TO LOCAL HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS FOR ACHIEVEMENTS DURING THE CURRENT YEAR OR DURING THEIR HIGH SCHOOL YEARS. ALL OF THE FUNDS PROVIDED THROUGH THESE PROGRAMS PROVIDE 100% TO RECIPIENTS/ORGANIZATIONS. 49 STUDENTS RECEIVED AWARDS IN 2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TO PROVIDE GRANTS AND/OR SCHOLARSHIPS FROM ITS ENDOWMENT FUNDS TO ALLOW THE FUND TO CONTINUE IN PERPETUITY. CURRENT GUIDELINES PROVIDE THAT THE FOUNDATION SHALL USE 5% OF THE AVERAGE MARKET VALUE OF AN ENDOWMENT FUND BASED UPON THREE CALENDAR YEAR END BALANCES PRECEDING THE YEAR THE GRANTS WILL BE AWARDED.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: SUPPORT OF MEDICAL CARE FOR UNINSURED CHILDREN.
EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE FOR RENT, UTILITIES, CAR REPAIRS.
TRANSPORTATION, RENTAL ASSISTANCE, SUPPLIES, WORKSHOPS FOR CHILDREN AND HOMELESS FAMILIES
SAFE STEP PROGRAM TO PROVIDE MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES TO CHILD ABUSE VICTIMS AND FAMILIES
EMERGENCY FUNDING AND ACTIVITY FEES FOR HOMELESS AND NEAR HOMELESS FAMILIES
MENTAL HEALTH TREATMENT FOR LOW-INCOME FAMILIES
FOOD FOR MOBILE LUNCH PROGRAM FOR CHILDREN IN LOW INCOME AREAS

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: THERESA TERRACE AND ELVER PARK NEIGHBORHOOD CENTERS

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: THERAPY COSTS FOR TRAUMA FOCUSED TREATMENT PROGRAM FOR LOW INCOME CHILDREN AND FAMILIES
THERAPY CARE COSTS FOR TRAUMA CRISIS RESPONSE SERVICES FOR CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES
PRODUCTION OF MENSTRUAL HYGIENE KITS, TRAINING IN SCHOOLS FOR BOYS AND GIRLS, TRAINING OF ENTERPRISES

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: TWO-YEAR AND FOUR-YEAR COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ORGANIZATIONS AND RECIPIENTS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT DOCUMENTATION BEFORE FUNDS ARE PAID OUT FOR THE PURPOSE INTENDED FOR THE GRANT OR SCHOLARSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ACCORDING TO THE FOUNDATION'S ARTICLES OF ORGANIZATION, ARTICLE SIX: ALL ACTIVE AND HONORARY MEMBERS OF THE ROTARY CLUB OF MADISON SHALL BE ACTIVE MEMBERS OF THE CORPORATION. THE TRUSTEES MAY ELECT ANY PERSON, WHETHER A MEMBER OF THE ROTARY CLUB OF MADISON OR NOT, HONORARY MEMBER OF THE CORPORATION, BY A TWO-THIRDS VOTE OF SUCH TRUSTEES. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES MAY DISCHARGE ANY HONORARY MEMBER FORM SAID CORPORATION BY A TWO-THIRDS VOTE OF SAID TRUSTEES. ACTIVE MEMBERS SHALL BE DISCHARGED WHEN THEY CEASE TO BE MEMBERS OF THE ROTARY CLUB OF MADISON.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DURING THE ANNUAL MEETING, MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATION VOTE FOR NEW TRUSTEES. FROM BYLAWS SECTION I. GENERAL POWERS: THE MANAGEMENT AND CONTROL OF THE CORPORATION SHALL RESIDE IN THE BOARD OF FOURTEEN TRUSTEES, TWO OF WHOM SHALL BE THE MOST RECENTLY RETIRED PAST PRESIDENTS OF THE ROTARY CLUB OF MADISON WHO ARE STILL MEMBERS OF THE CLUB, EACH OF WHOM SHALL SERVE A TWO-YEAR TERM. THE OTHER TWELVE TRUSTEES ARE TO BE ELECTED FROM THE MEMBERSHIP WITH A FOUR-YEAR, NON-RENEWABLE TERM, ON A STAGGERED BASIS OF THREE PER YEAR. ARTICLE III GENERAL OFFICERS SECTION I ELECTION: THE TRUSTEES SHALL ANNUALLY ELECT FOUR OFFICERS, A PRESIDENT, A VICE PRESIDENT, A SECRETARY, AND TREASURER. THE PRESIDENT AND VICE PRESIDENT SHALL BE ELECTED FROM AMONG THE TRUSTEES, BUT THE SECRETARY AND A TREASURER NEED NOT BE A TRUSTEE. THE PRESIDENT AND VICE PRESIDENT, TOGETHER WITH ONE OTHER TRUSTEE, TO BE SELECTED BY THE BOARD, SHALL CONSTITUTE AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, THIS COMMITTEE SHALL BE ENTITLED TO EXERCISE ALL THE POWERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES WHEN NOT IN SESSION, BUT SUBJECT TO THE DIRECTION THEREOF. ALL OFFICERS AND TRUSTEES SHALL HOLD OFFICE UNTIL THEIR SUCCESSORS ARE DULY ELECTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IF DECISIONS RELATE TO THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS OR THE MATTER CHANGES THE DIRECTION OF THE ORGANIZATION, THE MEMBERSHIP VOTES ON THE MATTER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY THE ACCOUNTING FIRM THAT HANDLES THE QUARTERLY ACCOUNTING REPORTS WHICH ARE DISTRIBUTED TO ALL FOUNDATION TRUSTEES AND OFFICERS. THE FORM 990 IS SHARED WITH THE OFFICERS PRIOR TO BEING FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EVALUATION PROCESS FOR DETERMINING THE COMPENSATION FOR THE SECRETARY IS CONDUCTED INDEPENDENTLY BY THE MADISON ROTARY CLUB. A COMMITTEE IS COMPRISED OF VOLUNTEERS THAT INCLUDE PROFESSIONALS WHO HAVE A KNOWLEDGE OF INDUSTRY DATA, AND THEY WORK WITH CURRENT MADISON ROTARY CLUB OFFICERS TO DETERMINE COMPENSATION FOR STAFF EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE ON REQUEST. WE ADVISE MEMBERS THAT ANYONE WISHING TO SEE OUR GOVERNING DOCUMENTS MAY REQUEST THEM FROM OUR OFFICE. THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE TO MEMBERS VIA OUR WEBSITE. WE ALSO PREPARE AN ANNUAL REPORT FOR MEMBERS TO PROVIDE DETAILED INFORMATION ON OUR GRANTS, PROGRAM FUNDS, ETC.
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: ACTIVITIES FOR MEMBERS, MEETINGS WITH SPEAKERS, AND COMMUNITY SERVICE
